sentence.text: Here, integrative genomic analysis identified protein acetylation as a potential oncogene target that is frequently amplified in breast cancer.

We found that protein acetylation was amplified in 11% and/or overexpressed in 15% of breast tumors, and overexpression of protein acetylation correlated with worse clinical outcome in estrogen receptor+ (ER+) breast cancers.
Interestingly, protein acetylation depletion drastically inhibited proliferation in MYST3-high, ER+ breast cancer cells, but not in benign breast epithelial cells or in MYST3-low breast cancer cells.
